intro: Cardamine lyrata, commonly known as the lyrated watercress, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to moist, shaded environments in North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants. The plant features delicate, trifoliate leaves that are often submerged or floating on the surface of water. Its small, white flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring. Cardamine lyrata is often found in wetlands, stream margins, and other aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats.
